Name: Maiden's Quest: Promo 4 – Baby Gem Dragon
Description:
On promo cards 2-5, you collect the signatures of up to 5 people when specific conditions are met. You afterwards integrate the signed card in your deck to get a bonus.

Condition for promo 4: when you assist during a Serendipity and they win the encounter.
Reward: use back of the card when setting up your deck.

Name: Maiden's Quest: Promo 5 – Drinking Steins
Description:
On promo cards 2-5, you collect the signatures of up to 5 people when specific conditions are met. You afterwards integrate the signed card in your deck to get a bonus.

Condition for promo 5: when you and another player both have Steins during a Serendipity, tap them together afterwards.
Reward: place in deck as extra discovered treasure.

Name: Dragon Castle: Single Player Mode
Description:
2-sided instructions to play Dragon Castle solitaire.
Handed out at Essen Spiel 2018.

Name: After the Virus: Promo Character Pack
Description:
A pack of three promo characters (Angela, Bill, Mac) previously released as pdf. Handed out at Essen Spiel 2018.
The characters have different starting decks as well as a different in-play item.

Name: Taste of Italia
Description:
Only a few minutes left before the closing of the supermarket. Will you have enough time to gather all the necessary ingredients to your Italian menu? Organise yourselves et cooperate because you can't do it on your own... A cooperative game for the whole family!

After all the tiles have been displayed, the first player turns a card showing 4 ingredients. He has, with the verbal help of the other players, to find the way of a single colour leading to the first ingredient of the list before he runs out of time. The next player can then try and find the second ingredient, and so on until the menu is complete.

Name: Luxor: The Gift of Luxor
Description:
Day 1 of Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo.

This Promo is only playable with the base game.
The rules of the base game remain unchanged, except as described in the promo rules.

There are 3 new Treasure tiles and 3 new Keys have switched from the base game.

Name: Emporous
Description:
"At the heart of the Royal Blue Sea, a position in the Council of the Great City of Menhos, political and economic capital of the Kelonic archipelago is now vacant. The leaders of the smaller islands eagerly seek to obtain that seat by gaining more influence through commerce and production.
    Trofí, the island of fishing and agriculture; Eide, the land of great sawmills; Calkino the island of bronze foundries; Latomeia, the quarry of the high seas; and Krasí, producers of the best grapes; all of them try to gain their place among the families that rule the Council, the capital’s founding families of a long tradition of master craftsmen. In their efforts, the emissaries of these islands can take the advantage of the founding families’ favour they obtain when gaining influence in the city or in exchange for a price."
    "Emporous" tells a story in two chapters, the second one being a more complex option for players who enjoy bluffing and negotiating in a more intense way. We advice to play the First Chapter before proceeding with the Second one, but that's not mandatory.
    In "Emporous" you are the sailing emissary of an island -called  "Emporous"- dedicated to raw material production, islands that compete to have the most economic influence in the Capital city, Menhos. As such, you must find the fastest way to acquire influence points by fulfilling contracts, commissioning artisan works and gaining Masteries. The First Chapter of our Story, "Kelonic Islands", is about these struggles.
    The game develops in a series of turns, in which you'll have to make a Trip, choosing whether to "Travel to your Island" to recover all your spent coins and bring back some raw materials your island produces; or to "Travel to the city" to perform one action, such as using your available resources to acquire different ones, to commission artisan works or fulfill your contracts. On the other hand, you can complete your objetives faster if you have the Council’s Seal, which grants you access to the benefits of having the founding families’ favour, Seal which you can obtain by gaining influence in the city or by giving the Council one of your coins.
    The Second Chapter of our Story, "The Council of Menhos" tells the real reasons behind all the changes in the Council, in which our Emporous will get tangled in a more complicated web of relationships with the council and with each other. In this Chapter, you'll have to complete Clandestine Tasks acquired during the game before it's end, while trying to get influence as fast as possible. If you fail to fulfill one or more of these tasks, you'll lose influece for each one of them.
    The graphic design in this game has been specificaly though of and developed for being accessible for people with a colour blindness condition, especially for protanopia and deuteranopia.

—description from the designer

"En el corazón del mar Turquí, uno de los asientos del Concejo de la Gran Ciudad de Menhos, capital política y económica del archipiélago Kelonico, ha quedado vacante. Los líderes de las islas más pequeñas buscan ávidamente obtener ese escaño ganando influencia a través del comercio y la producción.
Trofí, la isla de la pesca y la agricultura; Eide, la tierra de los grandes aserraderos; Calkino la isla de las fundiciones de bronce; Latomeia, la cantera de altamar; y Krasí, productores de la mejor vid; todos intentan ganar un lugar entre las familias que dominan el Concejo, familias fundadoras de la capital y de una larga tradición de maestros artesanos. En sus esfuerzos, los emisarios de estas islas podrán sacar ventaja de los favores de estas familias fundadoras que obtienen al ganar influencia en la ciudad o a cambio de un precio".
    "Emporous" cuenta una historia en dos Capítulos, siendo el segundo una opción más compleja para jugadores que disfrutan el "bluff" y la negociación un poco más intensa. Aconsejamos jugar el Primer Capítulo antes de proceder con el Segundo, aunque ello no es obligatorio.
    En "Emporous" eres el emisario navegante -llamado "Emporous"- de una isla productora de materias primas del archipiélago que compiten por obtener la mayor influencia económica en la ciudad capital, Mehnos. Como tal, deberás buscar la forma más rápida de conseguir puntos de influencia a través de contratos, artesanías y maestrías. El Primer Capítulo de nuestra historia, "Las Islas Kelónicas", se trata de estos esfuerzos.
    El juego se realiza en una serie de turnos de jugador, en que deberás realizar un Viaje, decidiendo entre Viajar a tu Isla a buscar tu producción y recuperar tus monedas, o Viajar a la Ciudad para realizar una acción como usar tus recursos disponibles para adquirir otros, encargar artesanías y cumplir con tus contratos. Por otra parte, podrás completar tus objetivos mucho más rápido si cuentas con el Sello del Concejo que te permite acceder a los beneficios de contar con el favor de las familias influyentes de Menhos, Sello que obtienes cuando ganas influencia en la ciudad o pagando una de tus monedas a las familias fundadoras.
    El Segundo Capítulo de nuestra historia, "El Concejo de Menhos", cuenta las verdaderas razones tras los cambios en le Concejo, en el que nuestros Emporous se verán enredados en una red de relaciones más complicada tanto con el Concejo como con los demás jugadores. En este Capítulo deberás completar Tareas Clandestinas adquiridas durante la partida antes de que ésta termine, mientras intentas conseguir la mayor cantidad de influencia lo más rápido posible. Si no consigues completar una o más de estas Tareas, perderás influencia por cada una de ellas.
    El diseño gráfico de este juego ha sido expresamente pensado y desarrollado para ser accesible para personas con daltonismo, especialmente protanopía y deuteranopía.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

Name: Crisis at Steamfall: Kickstarter Promo pack
Description: Contains 20 cards which can be used in competitive mode to play the Antagonist variant.

Name: Shadows: Amsterdam Promo tile
Description:
Promo tile for Shadows: Amsterdam

Celebrates the 10 years of Libellud, publisher of the game.

Frontside depicting a golden-haired rabbit dressed in pink blowing out a candle on a 10-year anniversary cake.

Backside depicting the silhouette of a signpost and mailbox against the backdrop of a city with an orange sky.

Tile can be shuffled in with the other tiles.

Name: Tarok Tarok: Dealers Duel Deluxe
Description:
An old twist on a modern design, a new table top experience based on the tarot decks of old. Pick your suit and build your kingdom, deploying heroes to fight and defend of attacks while your build your base and expand your empire. The suit features typical battle style cards, featuring themes from the old solitaire and tarot suits, as well as 22 major arcana wild cards that can turn the tide in your favor!

—description from the designer

Name: Lights, Camera, Pitch!
Description:
Lights, Camera, Pitch! is a card game for storytellers, film buffs and other creative types.

Players take on the role of screen producers who are competing for funding. Each player must pitch a film - inspired by the sets, actors and title cards they have in their hand - to "the studio" (another player). The studio asks tricky follow-up questions, makes annoying suggestions and decides which film to greenlight.

Name: Captain Gully's Buried Treasure Pirate Card Game
Description:
Captain Gully's Buried Treasure Pirate Card Game turns your table into a tropical island ready for everyone to begin their search for buried treasure. Yo-ho-ho pirates, you will enjoy digging for treasure that includes gold coins, diamonds, sapphires and rubies. Along the adventure, players must avoid rough seas and pirate thieves stealing your cards. Ages 4 and up. Players 2 - 4 and plays in approx. 10 - 15 minutes. Get ready to laugh and have fun, it's time to raise the anchor and set sail for buried treasure! This game is sure to make kids laugh when adults salute their pint-size captain or when forget what to do first. This game allows parents and grandparents to help children age 3 and age 4 to learn the game by making mistakes and not following the rules - and kids love to catch them!

There are multiple ways to play the game so that as kids age, you can add variety and difficulty to the game.

The goal is to collect the most treasure card sets (depending on the option played) and the rest of the cards to be in the discard pile.

Option 1 Use only the 40 treasure cards for a matching game.
Option 2 Collect the most treasure card pairs.
Option 3 Collect the most groups of 3 treasure cards.
Option 4 Collect one of each treasure to make a set. (Most sets wins).

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): The Swift Twins – Star Players
Description:
When it comes to Blood Bowl, the Swift twins have got it all: the looks, the charisma, the incredible outfits and, of course, the pure skill. There must have been something in the water where they grew up! Lucien (‘The Silver Bullet’, according to his official merchandise) was the first to rise to fame, as team captain and star Blitzer of the Galadrieth Gladiators. Under his leadership they won Blood Bowl X and Lucien himself amassed a serious haul of awards and plaudits. His brother Valen later followed in his footsteps, captaining the Elfheim Eagles and setting them up as one of the most promising new teams in the league. In recent years, tired of competing to top the leaderboards, the twins have begun hiring out their services as a pair.

This multipart resin kit contains the components necessary to assemble The Swift Twins. These models are a pair of Star Players for High Elf, Dark Elf and Elven Union Blood Bowl teams – they refuse to work alone, only as a pair. This means they’re quite expensive, but worth the gold – you won’t find a finer Thrower and Blitzer. The rules for using the Swift Twins can be found in The Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.

This kit comes as 12 components, and is supplied with 2 32mm Blood Bowl bases.

-description from the publisher's website

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): The Elfheim Eaglettes – Elf Cheerleading Squad
Description:
If you think the Elfheim Eagles have some moves then you haven’t seen their cheerleaders the Elfheim Eaglettes in action. Recruited from some of the most talented wardancers and blademaidens to grace the forests and islands of the collected Elven nations, they give a whole new meaning to the term ‘dance off’. So impressive are the acrobatic antics of the Elfheim Eaglettes that even Jim and Bob once famously spent an entire game commenting on the cheerleader’s routine, only afterwards realising that the Elfheim Eagles had won the game 9-0!

This multipart resin kit contains the components necessary to assemble the Elfheim Eaglettes. a 4-model Elf cheerleading squad. Slender and lithe, much like the team they support, they each have the standard pom-poms you expect from a cheerleader.

These models are supplied with 4 32mm Blood Bowl bases, and rules for using cheerleaders in games can be found in The Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.

-description from the publisher's website

Name: Blood Bowl: Shambling Undead Team – Champions of Death
Description:
From the publisher:

Shambling Undead teams are drawn from a mix of vicious undead creatures and former Blood Bowl players that died on the pitch and – through the art of necromancy – have been given the chance of a second career! Most famous of all the Shambling Undead teams that have graced (or stained) the pitch over the years are the mighty Champions of Death.

The Champions of Death team set contains 14 multipart plastic players covered in rusted armour, and eight thematic gaming accessories:

- 2 Mummies
- 2 Wights
- 2 Ghouls
- 4 Zombies
- 4 Skeletons
- 4 Shambling Undead Blood Bowl Balls
- 2 Turn Markers
- 2 Double-sided Score Coins

In addition, the set includes a Champions of Death transfer sheet, with decals that feature player numbers and the team’s logo, and a sample team roster to get you started.

Key Features
14 multipart plastic players for a Shambling Dead team

Also includes Shambling Undead accessories such as Turn Markers, Blood Bowl balls, a transfer sheet and a sample roster

Name: Dixit: "Pink Bunny" Promo Card
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo.

"Pink Bunny" is a promo card for Dixit: Harmonies as well as any other Dixit game.

Name: Sebastian Fitzek Safehouse: First Aid
Description:
Promo expansion for Sebastian Fitzek Safehouse.

A legacy booklet containing stickers to put over blank fields to make the following games easier or harder to win (and their corresponding rules).

Name: Alien Artifacts: Breakthrough
Description:
Alien Artifacts: Breakthrough, the second expansion for Alien Artifacts, takes place at the most intense point in human history! Face the new threats uncovered in Discovery, and experience new challenges for the space-faring factions. Humanity solved the mystery behind the alien technology and is ready to seize its powers!

Breakthrough adds new cards for your Alien Artifacts base game and arms you with new combos for your favorite game engines. This expansion includes 20 new technology cards, 10 new ship cards, and 10 new planet cards from the Expand category that will help you dominate the galaxy! Nothing can stop humanities technological breakthrough now!

—description from the publisher

Name: 51st State: Master Set – Allies
Description:
In 51st State: Allies, the second expansion for 51st State Master Set, you discover new ways to ally your factions! Cards now include a new alliance mechanism that grants you new unique bonuses and features. Will you try to unite the factions of the 51st State, or are you going to be a lone wolf? Will you create powerful combos between your allied cards? Finally, do you plan a welcome party for the three new factions that have crossed the wasteland and joined in the fray? Allies introduce Steel Police, Uranopolis, and Sharrash! With them, you will discover new ways to dominate the wasteland!

—description from the publisher

Name: Detective:  L.A. Crimes
Description:
Detective: L.A. Crimes, the first campaign expansion for Detective: A Modern Crime Board Game, consists of three separate cases that come together to form a full story. Travel to sunny California, and delve deep into the drug-filled Los Angeles of the 1980s. Experience being an L.A. detective, and realize that sometimes, like detective Foley from Beverly Hills Cop, you may need to stretch the laws a bit to suit your needs. Try some controversial methods to solve your case, all the while battling with the red tape of bureaucracy. Use all-new mechanisms of stakeout and observation to learn more about your suspects. The choices are yours, but are you willing to cross the line?

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Detective – A Modern Crime Board Game (Portal Games)

Name: Mystery Homes
Description:
Mystery Homes is a cooperative deduction game for 3 to 5 players, about 30 minutes play time.

The criminal lurking inside the players performs the crime during the night time (while the other players closed their eyes), then all the players cooperate and investigate the crime.

If the mystery is unraveled within the time limit, the "innocence" player wins, If it is not unraveled, the "criminal" player is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Aeon's End: Fleeting Vision Promo
Description:
Promo for Aeon's End, War Eternal, and/or Aeon's End Legacy (once the campaign is complete).

Promo from Game Trade Magazine November 2018.
Promo for preordering the German Version of Aeon's End War Eternal ("Für die Ewigkeit") from Frosted Games

Fleeting Vision
Cast: Deal 2 Damage. Each Player may reveal the top two cards of their deck and may discard any of those cards.

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Umber Greataxes
Description:
A trait that is often undervalued in war is flexibility. Sure, an army needs its specialists. Ones who can lead a charge, or hold back an assault, but a Unit that can do a little bit of everything is priceless when they step onto the field. The Umber Greataxes are that Unit for House Stark.

The warriors in the Umber Greataxes Unit Box for A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game are fiercely loyal to the Starks. They combine mobility, defense, and fearsome weaponry to make them one of the most versatile and deadly forces in the game. Many of the more traditional Commanders will find themselves unprepared for the Greataxes’ tactics, and the longer the battle goes… the stronger they become.

Contents:
12 Miniatures
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray

-description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Game of Thrones: Catan – Brotherhood of the Watch: Minor Houses of the North Promo
Description:
Promo contains 6 new house cards: Bolton, Cerwyn, Hornwood, Karstark, Mormont, and Umber.

During setup: Shuffle the 6 house cards and deal 1 card to each player face down.


     Isn't counted as a 7 roll and can't be stolen.
     On a 7 roll, it does not count towards your hand size.
     Play your card as described on it and then discard after 1 use.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire

Name: Fields of Green: Camels
Description:
2018 Essen Spiel Promo. Also included in Fields of Green: Grand Fair â€“ Kickstarter Promo Cards.

Camels, a new Livestock card!

- Cost: 4
- Star: 3
- Livestock - Ongoing / Diary, Work
Playablility: Whenever you build a Location within 2, you may play 1 food and get 3 coins.

This card is a cross-promo card for one of the publisher's upcoming games.

The promo set includes three copies of the Camels card.

Name: Altiplano: Alpaca Rider Role Tile
Description:
New Special Tiles. Mini expansion, contained in "Deutscher Spielepreis 2018 Goodie Box" and later contained in Level Up Loot 2.

The Deutscher Spielepreis 2018 Goodie Box is a product to support the Deutscher Spielepreis, the second-largest German board game award, in which thousands of players vote each year between May and July for their favorite game.

The Alpaca Rider is a new role tile for Altiplano, only playable with the Traveler expansion. The Alpaca Rider starts with 1 food, 1 alpaca, 1 ore, 1 opal and 1 coin. The Alpaca Rider's action requires any one good and can be used at any location. When you carry out the action, move your player pawn to the location where the Traveler is currently located.

Name: Black Stories: Spiel 2018 Edition
Description:
A promo pack with five Black Stories. It is contained in the Deutscher Spielepreis 2018 Goodie Box and was also given out at SPIEL 2018 for free at moses. Verlag GmbH's booth.
The promo stories feature art previously released in other Black Stories editions, but the text is new. Thematically, the five stories are about the SPIEL fair at Essen.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.

Name: Azul: Special Factories Promo
Description:
2 Special Factory Displays and 5 Double score markers, contained in "Deutscher Spielepreis 2018 Goodie Box".
The Deutscher Spielepreis 2018 Goodie Box is a product to support the Deutscher Spielepreis, the second biggest German board game prize, for which thousands of players vote each year between May and July for their favorite game.

2 Special Factory Displays
When setting up a game of Azul, return two of the usual Factory displays to the box and use the two new Special Factory displays in their place.
The game is played as usual. However, when picking tiles from a Special Factory display during the Factory offer phase, bear the new rules in mind.

5 Double Score Markers
When setting up a game of Azul place the 5 double score markers next to the Factory displays as a supply.
The game is played as usual. However, in this promo, carry out the Wall-tilling phase in player order, rather than simultaneously, starting with the first player and going clockwise.

Name: Rajas of the Ganges: Snake Expansion
Description:
New Special Tiles, contained in "Deutscher Spielepreis 2018 Goodie Box".

Contents: 4 province tiles "Shalimar Gardens" (1 per color)

Rules: Mix the tiles into the corresponding snake stack. To acquire one of these tiles, you have to carry out a building action, as usual. The costs for one of these tiles are one die in the color of the tile with any number, plus any other die.

Each tile allows the player to take back one of his already-placed workers so he gets an extra turn this round.

Name: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: Wolfgang's Exchange Office
Description:
New special tiles, contained in "Deutscher Spielepreis 2018 Goodie Box", that add extra scoring conditions that players can work towards throughout the game.

This mini-expansion can only be played when using the front sides of the cauldrons, as it uses the extra droplet from each player.

				
				
					Setup:Assemble the test tube stand (consisting of 2 parts) and place it in the middle of the table with the chosen side (brown or green) facing up. Place an unused droplet of each player's color on the leftmost test tube ("15" for the brown side, "12" for the green side).

				
				
					Gameplay:Whenever you get the opportunity to move your droplet forward in the course of the game, you may either move your droplet in your cauldron as normal or you may move your droplet on the test tube stand one test tube to the right.

				
				
					Scoring:Brown side: At the end of the game, all players empty their bags and add up the values of all of their chips in their bag and cauldron (white chips included). Each player divides their total value by the value of the test tube their droplet is at on the test tube stand, and this number is added as VP to their final score. For example, if the chips in your bag and cauldron add up to 60, you would gain 4 VP if your droplet is at "15" (60 divided by 15), but if you managed to get your droplet all the way to "2" you would gain 30 VP (60 divided by 2)!

Green side: During the course of the game, players may buy VP with their shopping coins in addition to buying ingredients. The price for each VP for a player is determined by the value of the test tube their droplet is at on the test tube stand. Players may purchase as many VP each round as they want and can afford.

Name: Dungeon Fighter: Jean Solo Promo Card
Description:
Jean Solo bonus card for Dungeon Fighter, handed out by Horrible Games at Spiel in Essen 2018.

Jean has 3 abilities that can be used after hitting a monster (Adrenaline: double damage; Scavenge: draw and distribute 3 equipment cards; Explore: Look at the topmost monster card from the tower).

When you Hit a Monster, place 1 XP on your Hero sheet (not on the Chest token). When you activate on of Jean Solo's special abilities, you must also discard the indicated amount of XP from your hero sheet. if you can't, you activate the ability.

ADRENALINE: Discard 3 XP. You may double the damage dealt by 
this throw OR recover 1 HP for each damage dealt.

SCAVENGE: Discard 2 XP. Draw 3 Equipment cards and put them aside face-down. Distribute these cards after the fight.

EXPLORE: Discard 1 XP. Look at the topmost Monster card from the tower, then either put it back or place it at the bottom of its pile.

Name: Journey Into The Beyond
Description:
You are already dead. One way or another, you have fallen to the lich Yor'Mir. They have locked your soul within their phylactery, along with their other victims they have slain. Within this cursed orb exists a demi plane known as the Ragnorwald. A cursed forest with one purpose: to kill its residents. Death is not permanent within this realm, but it is costly. With each death, the victim loses a cherished memory, which forms into ghostly blue crystals known as Essence. This Essence is what Yor'Mir desires, and as such is used as currency within the Ragnorwald. Once drained of all your memories, you become Forgotten.

But fear not, all hope is not lost. There is a way out, a gate which Yor'Mir uses to check on the Ragnorwald. Two small problems: First, whenever someone uses the gate, the Ragnorwald is reset. The second is the gate is guarded by a Keeper, a twisted monstrosity placed by Yor'Mir to keep the residence of the forest from escaping. Luckily for you, you are a Champion. A being capable of Awakening these memories. Remember your powers from your past life, collect essence to purchase powerful Items, and defeat the Keeper. However, you are not the only one with this plan... Race to be the first to slay the Keeper, lest you lose your progress when the plane is reset.

Journey Into the Beyond is an asymmetrical competitive tableau building adventure game. Inspired by epic fantasy games such as Talisman, Runebound and Mage Knight, Journey takes these long winded, large scale games and condenses it into a shorter more palatable experience. Players will notice right away that in the Ragnorwald, death is not only common and inconsequential, but often convenient. Fast paced highly strategic deterministic combat keeps the game flowing, and it's heavy player vs player elements keeps players interested even when it isn't their turn. Move around the board, choosing which stories to Encounter. Each Encounter type offers different risks and rewards, from fighting Goblins, exploring Dungeons, and even discovering critical information about the Ragnorwald itself.

Tabletop Simulator Link
https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1510019854

Discord
https://discord.gg/GnV5TpyMAg

YouTube Tutorials
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSq5JJx-Oy7wecuwMQBVirw

Name: The Brigade: Firewatch
Description:
FIREWATCH mini expansion for The Brigade.
Includes 8 new Location Tiles and 6 new Crew Member Cards featuring characters and locations from the new Tinderbox Tales games.

Name: Witless Wizards: Druid Deck Mini Expansion
Description:
Druids are friends of nature, using it to heal in more ways than usual. But their attack might should also not be underestimated.

An addtional eight card deck for Witless Wizards

Name: Witless Wizards: Viking Deck Mini Expansion
Description:
The Viking Deck is one of the most aggressive, giving your wizard the chance to deal extra hits at the cost of their own stamina.

An addtional eight card deck for Witless Wizards

Name: Witless Wizards: Trecker Promo Set
Description: A set of three additional cards to add to the choice of mini decks.

Name: Lost in the rain
Description:
"It is said that children who get lost in the city on a rainy day end up devoured by the sirains. The only way to escape those starving creatures is to find other lost kids and stay close to them at all times. It is also said that the sirains always find a way to seep into the most closely knit groups. By using evil thoughts, fear, hunger and loneliness, they lure their victims and snatch them, one by one, to devour them in the dark. In the end, only one lost child will find his way home. The others will never be seen again." Lost in the rain is a short roleplaying game of sadness and horror which invites you to take on the role of a child, lost in the great city and hunted by mysterious creatures.

Every player gets ten tokens at the start of the game. When a player loses their last token, the sirains eat them. Each turn (called a chapter) a player will be the main child for this chapter. The other players will play their child but also the sirains and the environment. Every time a player describes something that is frightening or harmful for the main child, the main child loses one token.
When only one child remains, their player can describe how their child finds the way back to their home.

Name: Zooloretto: Tierpark Hagenbeck
Description:
An expansion for Zooloretto, given out by Abacus at Spiel 2018 in Essen.
This expansion consists of 1 tile with Hagenbeck Zoo.

Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except for one rule: the first player, who fills his 6-space enclosure, takes the tile with the "Tierpark Hagenbeck" as a bonus from the middle of the table, placing it below his zoo board. It remains with this player until the end of game.
Once per game, when the player adds tiles to his zoo, he may put 2 coins at the "Tierpark Hagenbeck" to place an animal tile of a second type in one of his enclosures. From now on, animal tiles of both types may be placed to this enclosure.
Leopards may never be in an enclosure with another animal type!

Name: Soirée Pizza
Description: Party game containing 240 cards with questions related to films and series, divided into 4 categories (question, mime, true/false, identify the film). Each correct answer is worth 1 point, first player to 20 points wins. No rules are enclosed, so players can make up teams, assign a game master to ask the questions to all players, or adapt the amount of points necessary to win to shorten or extend the game's length.

Name: Die Legenden von Andor: Die verschollenen Legenden – Die vierte Statue
Description:
Promomaterial for: Die verschollenen Legenden "Alte Geister"

A further legend consisting of twelve cards, that mix-in with the extension 'Die verschollenen Legenden "Alte Geister"'

Name: Reykholt: Shed Promo Card
Description: Every time you sow at least once, choose a greenhouse with only one kind of vegetable. You can sow there as well with a different kind. Place goods only on top of other goods, not on empty slots. If you Harvest from this greenhouse, you take both goods from the slot.

Name: Reykholt: Brettspiel-Tischdecke Promokarte
Description: The card gives the option to move a farmer 1 table backwards, which allows you to take resources of your choice.

Name: Lowlands: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo.

Using:
After sorting the farm tiles during setup, add the new farm expansion tiles to their respective stacks. Then shuffle the stacks.

Name: Alubari: A Nice Cup of Tea – Hookah Promo Card
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo. Day 7

Using:
Each round, up to 3 times, you may pay 1 tea leaf of general supply and use it as if it were either an iron ore OR a stone as part of resolving an action. In addition, before placing your first worker of the round you may pay 1 chai to get your third worker form the Tea Stall and use it this round.

Name: War of the Buttons: The Flower Meadow & Little Sister
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo for Day 2.

In this promo are:
1. The Flower Meadow
2. Little Sister Marker

Using:
1. Get your "Little Sister" marker at the Flower Meadow.
2. Decide if you want to use it at the beginning of each following round.
3. Influence a location by playing the marker.

Just one active "Little Sister" marker per player.

Name: Wildlands: The Thorns & the Roses
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo. Day 15.

A micro-expansion for Wildlands.

A magical tangle of briars is growing uncontrollably throughout the ruins of the Empire. Get to your crystal shards quickly, or you'll have to fight your way through.

Name: Keyflower: Delivery Man
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo.

Starting on the delivery man tile, travel as far as possible along the road without travelling along the same length of road twice.

Crossing over a length of road previously travelled along is permitted. Score one point for each different tile on which you have travelled.

Name: Chopsticks
Description:
A fast and furious game for two players. In Chopsticks you are trying to score points by flicking a piece of sushi into your opponents goals using a chopstick. At the start of the game a wooden piece of sushi is placed in the centre of the board (the Bowl) then each player must address the sushi by touching it with their chopstick. As soon as each player has addressed the sushi the action can start. The wooden board consists of a walled, square arena with two goals at each end. The lower goal is worth 1 point and a detachable upper goal is worth 3 points. The winner is the first player to score eight points.

-description from designer

Name: Reykholt: Startup Financing Promo Pack
Description:
Consists of 6 tiles.

Accelerates the beginning of the game Reykholt.

Each Player draws 1 out of the 6 tiles, which can be played before or after the use of a worker.

Name: Pack of Crooks
Description:
Pack of Crooks is a semi-cooperative deckbuilding card game with a twist. Work as a team to pull off heists, then fight for the loot!

In Pack of Crooks, players are crooks who are working to complete jobs and collect loot. 
To successfully complete jobs, you will need to work with a bunch of other crooks. 
Your objective is to finish the game with the most loot.

To do this, you will need to purchase tool cards to build your own personal deck. 
You will then use the cards in your hand to defeat the security in each room and negotiate for your share of the loot.

To beat each security card, players must play tool cards of the same color to equal or higher value. 
For example, a Vault is a purple security card with a value of 20. Players will need to combine 20 points of purple tool cards. 
Players will need to negotiate to decide who will defeat each room card, and how the loot will be split. The combination of players that can play the most points wins.

The game is finished when all jobs are complete. Players should count their loot. 
Their tool cards are also worth the value they were purchased for. 
Cards from a player’s starting hand have no value.
The winner is the player with the highest total.

-description from publisher

Name: Deckfighters: Mixed Martial Arts Card Game
Description:
Deckfighters is the only fast paced single deck, multi-player elimination-style card game based on Mixed Martial Arts. While emulating the best of a real MMA fight, Deckfighters is a highly re-playable game with multiple win conditions, endless strategies and a swift learning curve. No deck building or card collecting allows the action to take affect immediately at the start of the game. The 54 card deck consists of STRIKING, GRAPPLING, SUBMISSIONS, DEFENSE, HEALTH, FINISH & SPECIALTY cards.

—description from the designer

Name: Berlin Manalaysay's Combatron: The Card Game
Description:
Based on the one of the most popular comic strips of the 90's from the Philippines legendary "Funny Komiks".

Players choose to fight for good or space domination by picking one of the Space Warriors and their arsenal - Combatron, Metalika, Death Metal or Abodawn. 
On a turn a player had to play one card (Power or Assist) and based on what players play, the action will take place.
Power vs Power - Player with the highest total power wins and deals damage to opponent
Power vs Assist - No Damage will be dealt but card effects will still trigger
Assist vs Assist - Both cards will cancel out each others effects.

Each damage will make a Space Warrior more powerful, a 3rd one will bring them their Ultimate! A player must deal 4 damages to defeat their opponent.
A player wins the game by being the last one standing and by then they will be called as the most powerful Space Warrior!

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Realms: Seeker Promo Card
Description:
Promotional card included with Game Trade Magazine Issue 225 (November 2018) The same card versions were also distributed during SPIEL 2018 with no Con-specific logo in the artwork.

Seeker
Blob Ship
Cost: 2
Primary Ability: Draw a card.
Ally Ability: Combat (3)
Scrapping Ability: Destroy target base.

Name: Coimbra: Royal Treatment
Description:
Inside you'll find a felt-lined box that serves as a dice tray. Players will also find 4 uniquely designed,  dual-colored dice that introduces deeper strategy with another challenging decision - an option for another income die or to trade resources for different income. Lastly, included is another end game scoring category.

Contents:

     1 Deluxe dice box (felt-lined)
     4 custom dice
     4 wooden bells (1 in each color)
     1 rule book

Name: Hakenschlagen
Description:
Who beats the best hook and wins the race?
A running game for the whole family.
   
Up to 5 rabbits go on the racetrack, sit on fields, dandelion, carrots and salad. Start and finish fields are identical, every bunny has to go back and forth across the field. The winner is the player whose rabbit is the first to return.

At the start of the game colorful leaves are distributed on the field and thus the appropriate fields for carrots, salad and dandelion are set. The matching marbles are in a cotton bag. Drawn blind, they indicate the way of the rabbits.

A red fox and tall trees are slowing down the rabbits. A molehill on the other hand prolongs the leap of the rabbits.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Table is Lava: Coconuts edition
Description:
This expansion adds a 5th player (pink) to "The Table Is Lava". It comes with the meeples for the 5th player and replacement cards for the base game so that the pink meeples get put into play by the other players. The original card 4 (four differently colored meeples) is replaced by a similar card 5.

The overall game concept doesn't change at all.

Name: Altitude: Yeti Promo Card
Description: Promo card with a Yeti. When you get this card you can scare a free animal off an opponent's mountain.

Name: Vertical: Refuge Goodie
Description:
Make a refuge on your way up the mountain so you won't fall down.

It works like a carabine, if your character climbs up the mountain and you get the fall down tile, you only fall down to the refuge.

Name: Le Football Aux Des
Description:
Le Football Aux Des is a real simple game, published in French in the Annual Book
of Selection du Reader's Digest "L 'Album des Jeunes".

It's a football game where each player rolls a die and the higher number wins the ball and passes or shoot to goal (depending his position on the field).

—user summary

Name: Die Unglaubliche Geschichte, wie die Mücke zum Elefanten wurde
Description: Naughty, self-ironic and wonderfully simple: Who has not ever wondered how the hell a tiny mosquito can turn into a giant elephant? An anatomical miracle? Magic? An amazingly plausible answer is Ina Hattenhauer with her cheeky illustrations. Almost at the flip of a dime, she transforms the insect into a pachyderm. An unusually bold and super-easy card game. Bring big and small to the game table. Simple card game for in between. With funny and cheeky illustrations. Here's how it works: Each player gets 7 cards in his hand. In turn, the players discard the cards. But beware: you can only take one equal or higher card. If you can not, draw a card. Who has no more cards in the end, wins.

Name: The Castles of Burgundy: 10th Expansion – Solo
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo for day 25.

Castles of Burgundy "Solo" is a mini expansion including 1 double sided board.

All rules of the base game apply, except for the following exceptions and additions:

GAME SETUP
Take one Silverling and 2 worker tiles, plus a starting castle. Place the castle on any castle space on your player board (The A side is better for beginners, the B side for advanced players). Take 3 random goods and put them next to the board. In solo game there is no restriction for the number of different types (= colors) of goods that you can collect.

Choose a color and take both playing pieces and dice of that color, plus the white die. Place one of your pieces on space 0 of the victory point track as a victory point counter and the other piece on the 50 as target marker. Continue setting up the game as usual for a 2-player game (hex tiles, goods, etc.)

PLAYING THE GAME
You are playing 25 rounds. At the beginning of each round, throw all 3 dice:

- First, take the topmost goods tile and place it on the depot indicated by the white die.

- Then remove a hex tile from that depot from the game, starting from the top to bottom (depots 2, 3, 5 and 6) or left to right (depots 1 and 4) respectively. If a depot is empty, remove a hex tile from the next depot in clockwise order etc.

Next, perform your 2 dice actions as usual, with the same effects and victory point gains as in the base game, except for the following restrictions and changes:

- You can only expand to other territories via the rivers.

- Whenever you place a ship, take all goods from a depot of your choice, then immediately remove all other goods from all other depots from the game.

In addition, you now (and only now!) have the option to exchange any 5 of your goods for a single tile from the black depot (the 5 goods tiles are removed from the game). Place that tile face down (i.e. its black side up) on one of your three storage spaces. A "black tile" can be placed on any color space on your board, as long as you follow the base game placement rules. Placing a black tile helps you to complete a region (to gain victory points, a color bonus and for winning the game) but has no other effects.

For example: a "black mine" won't generate Silverlings at the beginning of the phase. A "black ship" gains neither goods nor the option to exchange 5 goods for a "black tile".

- Victory points from a yellow Knowledge tile are added immediately after placing it (instead of at the end of the game).

- You won't gain victory points as color bonus when completing a color. Instead, choose a tile from the black depot and place it directly on the board, with all its effects, following the base game placement rules. If that completes another color, take an additional tile from the black depot (if available), place it on your board, etc.

- Whenever you gain victory points, move your victory point counter that many spaces. In addition you may buy now further victory points. Each victory point costs 1 Silverling.

When your victory point counter reaches the target victory point marker, put it back on space 0 (any remaining victory points are lost), then move the target marker down 5 space (e.g. from 50 to 45, next time to 40 etc).
Immediately after resetting the victory point counter you may carry out a dice action of your choice (just as if you had added a castle to your estate).

END OF THE GAME
You win the game if you manage to occupy all 37 hex spaces of your estate within 25 rounds.

Name: Cthulhu Kids: Cosmic Catastrophe
Description: Cthulhu Kids: Cosmic Catastrophe is a battle card game inspired by the Cthulhu mythos. Use attacks by characters from the HP Lovecraft's Cthulhu mythos, augment them with dice rolls, and play extra power cards to alter the course of an attack. The first to win 3 attacks wins the game.

Name: Gùgōng: Bonus Travel Tokens
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo for Day 9.

The GùgÅng Bonus Travel Tokens is a micro expansion.

Add these Bonus Travel Tokens to the other Travel Tokens and mix them all together. When you claim one of these Bonus Travel Tokens, keep them face up in front of you. You may use these in combination with an action or Gift Card exchange. Once you use their ability, flip them face down and place them on your Player Board on the appropriate space.

TOKENS
"x2" - Double the value of any 1 Gift Card you play.

"2x" - Get the Bonus/Secondary action of 1 gift twice. When performing a secondary action twice, play both actions separately.

"Jade/Decree Discount" - You can once reduce the price for a single Jade or Decree by two Servants. You do not receive one Servant if the discount would amount to a negative amount.

This micro expansion is included in GÃ¹gÅng (Multilingual deluxe edition).

Name: Votoms Tactics
Description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese animation series "Armored Trooper VOTOMS".
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armored_Trooper_Votoms

Players control one or more Armored Troopers, aka VOTOMS (Vertical One-man Tank for Offense & ManeuverS).

In the plot phase you set 3 mission disk cards. Each mission disk card designate movement speed, movement direction and combat availability. In the action phases, players alternate flipping a plotted card one by one, resolving movement and combat.

10 scenarios reproduce the various battles in the story. Victory conditions are defined for each scenario. For example, destruction of enemy troops or specific target, escape from the battlefield etc.

Name: Murder on a Train
Description:
In the coldest month of 1933, somewhere near the Austrian border, passengers aboard the Simpleton-Orient Express experience a murder that will change their lives forever! But who killed mysterious stranger John Doe? Go full steam ahead with up to 7 female and 7 male passengers!

—description from the publisher

Name: Folklore: The Affliction – Giant Scorpion Promo Card
Description:
This promo card adds a new animal companion to the game.

"You may make 2 attacks during skirmishes. Exhaust to put a corrosion token on a foe that just hit you.
Animal (Meele)"

The card ID is C0#FX03
The promo card was available at Spiel 2018 in Essen.

This promo was also included in the Folklore Missing Card Pack (GNEFL47).

Name: Folklore: The Affliction – Faery Wisp Promo Card
Description:
This promo card adds a new animal companion to the game.

"+1 Search, acts as a light source. Exhaust to teleport up to spaces.
Animal (ranged)"

The card ID is C0#FX04
The promo card was available at Spiel 2018 in Essen.

This promo was also included in the Folklore Missing Card Pack (GNEFL47).

Name: Folklore: The Affliction – Spectral Fox Promo Card
Description:
This promo card adds a new animal companion to the game.

"Gain a Boon at the beginning of each chapter. Exhaust Spectral Fox to un-exhaust another card you own.
Animal (Ranged)"

The card ID is C0#FX05
The promo card was available at Spiel 2018 in Essen.

This promo was also included in the Folklore Missing Card Pack (GNEFL47).

Name: Folklore: The Affliction – Transformed Sage Promo Card
Description:
This promo card adds a new animal companion to the game.

"+1 Occult, immune to transformed, your first attack each round gains vorpal.
Animal (Meele)"

The card ID is C0#FX01
The promo card was available at Spiel 2018 in Essen.

This promo was also included in the Folklore Missing Card Pack (GNEFL47).

Name: Dwar7s Fall: Dwar7s Winter Promos
Description:
Dwar7s Fall promo pack that was included as a stretch goal during the Dwar7s Winter Kickstarter campaign. It adds a new variation to the game called "Allies". It includes the following cards:

7 Allies cards
2 Rules
4 Ogree cards

Name: Penny Breadful
Description:
Our first handmade game is a real wonder. We hand crafted and laser cut cork to cram a 2-6 player game into a tiny pocket sized loaf of bread. Penny Breadful is a reverse bluffing game where players vie to be the last one who survives! Deceive your opponents into eating poisoned slices while you save the safe ones for yourself. Each loaf is separated into 4 chapters that act as player elimination minigames. Game night will never be the same again!
A small-batch reverse bluffing game of survival. 
COMING SOON to Kickstarter in 2024.

—description from the publisher

Name: Penguin Brawl: Heroes of Pentarctica – Battle of the Gods
Description:
Penguin Brawl: Battle of the Gods is the first micro-expansion for Penguin Brawl and adds 30 new cards to the game which comprise of six new character cards and their associated gear, spells and instants.

Battle of the Gods also adds a brand new mechanic to Penguin Brawl in the form of Blessings. Blessings work in a similar way to curses wherein they must be played the moment they are drawn, however Blessings, as the name suggests, do nice things, unlike their curse counterparts which are specifically there to ruin your day.

New characters include Zeus, Ra, Odin, Ah-Muzen-Cab, Anansi and Jupiter. This expansions characters are based on the Greek, Roman, Norse, Egyptian, Mayan and Akan pantheons.

Name: Carson City: Father Christmas Promo
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo. Day 12.

When using Father Christmas, you immediately receive 5 victory points as a gift since you've been sweet this year. 
Cash limit $10

Red side: Immediately receive 2 victory points and write a letter to Father Christmas. Throw a die to check if you have been naughty or nice:

     1-2: you've been very naughty, you don't receive anything
     3-4: you've been OK: receive $5.
     5-6: you've been very nice: receive $5 and 1 cowboy in your player color (as long as the are available).


Cash limit: $10

Name: Dice Hospital: Pharma Rep Administrator Promo Card
Description:
Administrator card for Dice Hospital.

Backers of the Dice Hospital Kickstarter received this promo for free if they Kickstarted Pocket Pharma.

Pharma Rep: a patient in your hospital counts as any color for this round

Name: Ground Floor (Second Edition): Architect's Office & Telecommunications Floor
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo for Day 19.

Telecommunications floor
An additional floor improvement tile is added to the group of floor improvements tiles in Stage 2. It is the second tile of that name and functions identically.

Architect's Office
This Expansion Board tile should be placed near the game board. It adds a new area for players to visit.
1. Schedule Business: Only one player may use the Architect's Office.
2. Conduct Business: The Architect's Office is resolved after Retail Outlets and before the Construction Company.

Name: Teotihuacan: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo.

Contents: 
2 Starting tiles for Teotihuacan: City of Gods.

Rules:
Before setting up a game of Teotihuacan: City of Gods, replace two random Starting tiles form the game with the two starting tiles from this mini-expansion.

In 2020, became available as part of the Teotihuacan: City of Gods – Promo Bundle

Name: Carthago: Merchants & Guilds – Support of the Guilds
Description:
Promo Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 for Day 18.

The Support of the Guilds mini-expansion offer players permanent in-game abilities in addition to earning victory points at the end of the game! The 6 new tiles may be used in any combination with the Achievement Tiles (AT) from the base game.

The tiles offer additional ways for players to earn points at the end of the game or, in exchange for the potential to earn extra points, players can take an additional turn during the game.

Name: Crisis: Renewable Energy Modules
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo.

At the end of the evaluation phase the renewable energy module tile is given to the player with the least VP. If both tiles are in the game, they are given to the players with the least and second least VP.  If there is a tie for least VP, the tile is given to the tied player who is last in turn order.

During 4.13 Production any players with a renewable energy module tile can place it on any one of their activated company that has energy as an input resource.

The tile covers all energy needs of that company for that production round, regardless of how many energy resources are needed.

After resolving this, the players return any renewable energy module tiles that they hold back next to the game board.

Name: The Brigade: Bernhardt Blaze
Description:
A new warden (centaur) available as a promo in 2017 and through the Kickstarter campaign.

Text from the card:
Allegiances: Until your next turn event cards do not effect blocks that are loyal to you.

Name: Penny Papers Adventures: The Temple of Apikhabou – Santa's Secret Lair
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo for Day 20.

Something terrible is happening in North Pole: All the cute elves of Christmas have been turned into dangerous zombies!
Penny Papers has been called by Santa Claus to secure his famous hidden factory. In return, she will have the right to keep a few presents to bring back home.

This new map is to be played with the "The Temple of Apikhabou" box. Rules of the game remains the same, with different modifications.

Name: Quickfire
Description:
Quickfire is a two-player dice-flicking dexterity game. Each player receives 3 dice and place them on three podiums on their side of the board. Three dice of a neutral colour are placed in the centre of the board.

On the count of three the players then flick their dice at the three target dice. The round ends when either 1) there are no target cubes left to aim at, or 2) one player is out of dice. The scores are then tallied: 1 point for each die in the opponent’s tray and 1 point for each of the opponent’s dice that have left the board. If one of the players is out of cubes, the other scores 1 point for each target die left in the field of play. The first to 9 points wins the game.

Name: Magnificent Flying Machines: Siobhán O'Hara
Description:
A new pilot.

May use as a luck token 3 times during the game.

Name: Kitchen Rush: Sauerbraten Beef
Description: German cuisine order card, included in the Kickstarter promos for Piece of Cake. Sauerbraten beef with a side of red cabbage and dumplings.

Name: Die Legenden von Andor: Die verschollenen Legenden – Launische Waldgeister
Description:
Promo for Die verschollenen Legenden.

It is a single card expansion and increases or decreases the difficulty.

It was offered at the SPIEL '18 fair during the signing sessions of the designers.

Name: Dungeon Allies
Description:
Each player starts with two adventurers who have beginning spell or weapon abilities.  These abilities are designated by a 4 or 6 sided die.  Players increase their skill all the way up to a 20 sided die.  The die is placed on the area of the board showing their action.  They battle creatures in the catacombs, find and fight for crystals and gold, recruit new followers in the tavern, advance their skill with the trainer, gain special bonuses with the sorcerer, and trade crystals in the village.  When the catacombs are cleared out, the game ends with the player holding the most special sorcerer points and gold the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Truco o Trato
Description:
Trick or treat is a game for children and family, for 2 to 4 players, with a duration per game of 15 minutes, in which each player will play a classic character of horror literature and send monsters from house to house to look for candy during Halloween Night. The recommended age to play autonomously is 6 years.

Dracula, the Wolf Man, the Mummy, the Creature of the Lake ...with these and many more monsters, each player will have to try to be more afraid than their rivals to get all the candies of their color before the end of the Halloween night.

—description from the designer (translated)

Truco o trato es un juego infantil y familiar, de 2 a 4 jugadores, con una duración por partida de 15 minutos, en el que cada jugador encarnará a un personaje clásico de la literatura de terror y enviará monstruos de casa en casa a buscar caramelos durante la Noche de Halloween. La edad recomendada para jugar de forma autónoma es de 6 años.

Drácula, el Hombre Lobo, la Momia, la Criatura del Lago...con estos y muchos más monstruos, cada jugador/a tendrá que procurar dar más miedo que sus rivales para conseguir todos los caramelos de su color que pueda antes de que termine la Noche de Halloween.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

Name: Stackers
Description:
Stackers is played starting on a regular hexagonal base board consisting of 24 triangles.

Each turn, a player can place a piece consisting of three triangles on the lowest level, the second lowest, etc., until he adds a new level or passes. No two adjacent triangles can have the same colour, but all stacked triangles should have the same colour.

Once there are nine levels, stacked pieces can extend beyond the horizontal limits of the base board. (Even pieces that are placed on lower levels.)

The player who first manages to play all his pieces, wins.

Name: Ravioli Roadhogs
Description:
Ride around Raphael's ranch in a rapid race to reap rich rewards!

This game was designed live at the Penny Arcade Expo (PAX) Australia 2018, during the "Let's Make a Board Game - Live!" panel. 'Ravioli Roadhogs: The Pasta and the Furr-ious' was created on audience suggestions and then condensed into a tabletop board game to be added to the PAX Aus Tabletop Library (and in print-and-play through BGG).

Players are Italian hedgehogs planning their best routes to reach each rewarding cuisine. Plan your route, roll your dice, place your pasta al dente, but aim well or hit the rocky road.

The first player to collect all three dishes and return to the Start line wins!

-description from designer

Name: Bloody Christmas: A holiday themed drinking game for anytime of the year.
Description:
Bloody Christmas is a drinking boardgame that tasks a group of players to make their way to the bar and then back home. The first player to do so wins. To do so they take turns rolling a six sided die and simply move that number of spaces on the gameboard.

There are three types of spaces you may land on. Drink spaces require pulling a drink card from a pile in the center of the gameboard and simply taking that number of drinks before throwing the card in a discard pile to be shuffled and placed back in the center when there are no more drink cards to draw.

Fight spaces require the player to draw a fight card from the pile in the center of the board. These unique characters all have a power rating from 1 to 6. The player then has to roll a six sided die against the power of the fight card. If they win they keep the card and can use it once against their opponents to knock them back on the gameboard a number of spaces equal to the power of the card. If they lose they drink the difference of their roll and the power of the fight card as well as move back that many spaces on the gameboard.

The third type of spaces are home and the bar themselves. These are safe spaces where no fighting can occur. Otherwise no two players can occupy the same space on the board and will have to fight each other (by each rolling dice) to see who stays on the space and who gets bumped back the difference of the two rolls on the gameboard.

—description from the designer

Name: Escape the Marshlands
Description:
It's a card game in which you battle other players using Zombies, Werewolves, and Vampires to be the last survivor and escape!

Players take turns either drawing a card from the deck or attacking another player. Drawing a card can get you useful items to Empower your attack, or help you Repel an attack. You may also gain more Monsters to use in battle. But watch out! There's cards that will Condemn your Monsters too, and you'll have to discard part of your Monster horde.  You may also find extra Protection to fortify your army, or a rogue Thief to help you plunder cards from an opponent. Battles are decided with a roll of the dice - more torches on your roll means you defeated those Monsters! When all the cards in the draw pile are gone, then begins Armageddon. You MUST attack on your turn during Armageddon, until there is only one player left alive. He is the one who Escapes the Marshlands! Will it be you?

—description from the designer

Name: Kitchen Rush: Piece of Cake – Kickstarter Promos
Description:
One box which includes all the content that was generated through the Kitchen Rush: Piece of Cake crowdfunding campaign.

It includes:
US Cuisine Order cards (10 cards)
French Cuisine Order cards (10 cards)
Player Talents Mini Expansion (9 cards) 
Dessert Critic Mini Expansion (5 cards)
4 Event Cards
A Campaign Booklet that allows you to play a series of interconnected games!

Name: Gen7: The Breaking Point
Description: The Breaking Point, an expansion for Gen7: A Crossroads Game, includes more story content, a competitive play mode and more barracks, allowing for games with up to six players.

Name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – "Time Travel" Scenario
Description:
Time Travel is a completely new, 11th scenario for Robinson Crusoe.

It was created by Themistoklis Dakanalis, the 2017 contest winner. Time Travel will take you (no surprise there) back in time, to an era of dangerous beasts and rare healing plants. Your goal would be to save your own life in the race against time itself! Never have you played anything like that in Robinson Crusoe.

Time Travel was part of the Robinson Crusoe Event Kit 2018.
Families: Game: Robinson Crusoe – Adventures on the Cursed Island

Name: Vojo
Description:
In the most needy Africa, nothing is easy for the most isolated villages. Vojo is a card game of adventure and strategy in which you must build your best route overcoming difficulties and crossing the different territories to achieve your goal, bring the water to those who need it most. Overcoming earthquakes or dodging thieving monkeys are just some of the tests you will have to pass in your adventure.

—description from the publisher

Name: Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift – The Cannibal's Howl
Description:
Mogba'gh is a feared shaman, a ju-ju man with unparalleled powers and even here, far away from the nature spirits of the ancestral forest, Mogba'gh wields abilities beyond normal comprehension. It's said that he is not an albino by birth, but rather became one due to a botched witchery. It's not known by anyone but Elisa why Mogba'gh is here or what he aims to do, but so far everyone has been very content with the idea of having another magus in their midst, even one as strange as him.

Mogba'ghs pointily filed teeth, his general behaviour and dark stories about culinary pleasures have formed a reputation of a repugnant, barbaric cannibal that he seems to enjoy and cultivate at every possible moment.

Mogba’gh offers a versatile and unique hero addition to your Perdition’s Mouth. A close range magic user with a wide variety of spells, you can make very effective Special combo’s with him.

For quite some time, our fans have asked for Mogba’gh to be made available again. We listen to our fans.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Devil's Level
Description:
You had to go to the mall. You can't find your car in the parking lot. You're terrified of elevators. And the mailman just saw your ass.

In The Devil's Level you attempt to balance your Depression, Horny, and Genius levels to achieve a state of Chillin. Then, and only then, will you be on The Devil's Level.

The Devil's Level is a fast-paced, weird card game for 2+ players and contains mature concepts for ages 18+

Players play level cards to achieve a total of 6 for each type of level. "Stuff" cards provide permanent powers, "Effects" are one-time use. "Irony" cards can cancel other cards. Contains 144 cards.

—description from the back of box

Name: Immortal Paths
Description:
The Elementals have challenged the greatest heroes in the land to take the Immortal Paths: an ancient challenge of fire, earth and water. Many have tried but few win.

Each Hero must make their way across nine obstacle challenges of Fire, Earth and Water.

Summon bridges of Stone, Wood or Rope bridges to build the longest possible connected paths that create powerful multipliers and gain you the highest score to win.

Watch your challengers - choose your bridge summoning cards wisely. Seek your advantages at every turn! Choose poorly and you will join those who fell in peril.

The highest score will crown the next champion of the Immortal Paths!

—description from the publisher

Name: After School Curse Club
Description:
As an avid member of Ito High School’s After School Curse Club, a group of girls who enjoy getting together to tell ghost stories, you’ve always dreamed of encountering a real YÅ«rei (A vengeful Japanese spirit). Unfortunately, after participating in a childish game meant to summon spirits, you get your wish.

Now, trapped in the high school after dark, it’s up to you and your fellow club members to search the school and find six Talismans to stop the blood thirsty YÅ«rei you summoned from killing you all.

After School Curse Club is a roll and write style role playng game that is easy and fast to play. It is suitable for up to four players but works best solo.

—description from the designer

Name: Adventures of a Classroom Exorcist!
Description:
A solitaire Tarot card game of making connections and finding demons.

In this game you take on the role of a teenage exorcist. You had transferred to this school when you learned of a demon possessing one of the students. As you arrive, you can sense the demon within but cannot pinpoint the exact student.

During the following schoolyear it’s your job to make as many allies as you can, identify your foe and drive out the demon. But remember, the demon will be turning your classmates against you too.

'—description from the introduction

The game is provided as a print-and-play PDF document (25 pages).  Several pages of the document are needed for reference during play (even for experienced players).  Play requires a Tarot deck of cards, though a mapping table can be used to play with a standard pack of French playing cards.  Play involves card distribution into several distinct, named piles (Friend, Classmate, Rival, and Discard).  When play begins, most cards are placed in the Classmate pile representing students.  The goal of play is to transfer cards from the Classmate pile to the Friend pile.  The "demon" works against you, moving cards from the Classmate pile to the Rival pile.

Play proceeds in three phases.  During the first phase the identity of the "demon" is unknown.  During the second phase the identity of the "demon" is known.  The third phase is the final period of the game when the player and the "demon" have the "final battle" - the outcome of which determines if the solitaire player wins or loses the game.

The first two phases essentially are discovery and building phases, with the player attempting to gather as many resources as possible (thus denying them to the "demon") - this is represented by the distribution of cards into the Friends or Rivals piles.  The third phase determines victory in the game - the player wins, or the "demon" wins (thus, the player loses).

Throughout the game, the principle action involves card manipulation to influence a basic card vs. card flip where the winner, by default, is determined by suit and rank (court cards always beat number cards, etc.).  Too, each court card is identified as a specific "student" in the school, and each student has variable power.  For example, "The Sun" equates to student "Hiroko Harunobu" - who has specified powers over "The Moon".  Unsurprisingly, "The Moon" equates to Hiroko's younger twin, "Horie Harunobu" - who has specified powers over "The Sun".

Because the cards are randomly distributed by shuffling, replay will always be unpredictable.  While essentially a solitaire card game at heart, the extended game concept and especially the variable card effects create quite a nuanced game that would lend itself well to an immersive experience.

—user summary

Name: Coffeetopia
Description: In Coffeetopia, players compete to satisfy coffee import requests from nations across the globe. As Indonesian coffee exporters, players collect coffee beans, manage their warehouses and fulfill contracts in this strategic simultaneous action selection game.
